creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: swallow's nest hangs from TL edge; adult swallow perched on edge of nest, three babies in nest; another swallow flying away at LR
markings: (a) LRC, two seals follow signature, first one overlaps with last part of signature.  1: {shin zai san sui no kan} {kokoro mizu no ma no yama ni ari}, (My heart is in the mountains between the streams); 2: {Sekkei no in}
object_name: Hanging scroll, one of a pair
text:
The left scroll shows a rabbit jumping from the moon into the ocean. According to legend, a rabbit resides on the moon, where he pounds rice flour into sticky rice cakes (mochi). The large harvest moon references autumn, while the swallows in the right scroll are associated with spring and summer.
(2013.31.15.1-.2)
title: Swallows [right of the pair Rabbit and Swallows]
